SEARCH

Class BinarySearchTree

java.lang.Object
BinarySearchTree
class BinarySearchTree extends Object
BinarySearchTree class implements a Binary Search Tree data structure Supports insertion, traversal, search, and min/max operations CS-380 Lab Assignment #2
Author:
Orchlon Chinbat (50291063)

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    (package private) Node
    root
    The root node of the binary search tree

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Node
    delete(Node root, int key)
    Deletes a node with the specified key from the binary search tree Handles three cases: leaf node, one child, and two children
    boolean
    find(Node root, int key)
    Searches for a node with the specified key in the binary search tree Uses BST property: left subtree has smaller values, right has larger
    int
    getMax(Node root)
    Finds the maximum value in the binary search tree The maximum is the rightmost node in the tree
    int
    getMin(Node root)
    Finds the minimum value in the binary search tree The minimum is the leftmost node in the tree
    void
    inOrderTraversal(Node root)
    Performs in-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Left -> Root -> Right For a BST, this produces values in sorted ascending order
    Node
    insert(Node root, int value)
    Recursively inserts a new value into the binary search tree
    void
    postOrderTraversal(Node root)
    Performs post-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Left -> Right -> Root Useful for deleting trees (delete children before parent)
    void
    preOrderTraversal(Node root)
    Performs pre-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Root -> Left -> Right

    • preOrderTraversal

      public void preOrderTraversal(Node root)
      Performs pre-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Root -> Left -> Right
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree to traverse

    • inOrderTraversal

      public void inOrderTraversal(Node root)
      Performs in-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Left -> Root -> Right For a BST, this produces values in sorted ascending order
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree to traverse

    • postOrderTraversal

      public void postOrderTraversal(Node root)
      Performs post-order traversal of the binary search tree Visits nodes in the order: Left -> Right -> Root Useful for deleting trees (delete children before parent)
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree to traverse

    • find

      public boolean find(Node root, int key)
      Searches for a node with the specified key in the binary search tree Uses BST property: left subtree has smaller values, right has larger
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree to search
      key - the value to search for
      Returns:
      true if the key is found, false otherwise

    • getMin

      public int getMin(Node root)
      Finds the minimum value in the binary search tree The minimum is the leftmost node in the tree
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree
      Returns:
      the minimum value in the tree

    • getMax

      public int getMax(Node root)
      Finds the maximum value in the binary search tree The maximum is the rightmost node in the tree
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree
      Returns:
      the maximum value in the tree

    • delete

      public Node delete(Node root, int key)
      Deletes a node with the specified key from the binary search tree Handles three cases: leaf node, one child, and two children
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree or subtree
      key - the value of the node to delete
      Returns:
      the root node after deletion
